pr_title: Add Version information to RC template

timeline.message: Add Version information to RC template

timeline.bodyText: I did not want to throw here as the backend ideally should not provide invalid date time strings... Open to suggestions :)
timeline.author: lahirumaramba

replies.bodyText: I think it's reasonable to throw IllegalStateException or something and fail fast.

timeline.bodyText: Everything except description can be made final.
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: List factory methods after the constructors.
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: May be just compare the long values.
timeline.author: hiranya911

timeline.bodyText:
I noticed that the update time is represented in FC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, accurate to nanoseconds. Added new code here to convert the timestamp to milliseconds properly.
DateTime does not handle nanoseconds so I had to drop them from the timestamp string before parsing. Otherwise SimpleDateFormat considers nanoseconds as milliseconds and add it back to the time making the parsed date/time incorrect.
Apparently, there are better ways to handle nanoseconds in Java8 (LocalDateTime and Instant) :)
timeline.author: lahirumaramba
hiranya911

timeline.bodyText: Instead of a complex regex, why not just strip away everything (and including) the period? That seems easier and more readable.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: Makes sense! Updated the code to use substring()
replies.author: lahirumaramba

timeline.bodyText: I'd advise splitting this into multiple smaller test cases. You can define some class-level constants for values that should be shared across test cases.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I use all the template instances created here in a series of assertNotEquals() at the end of the test... would it be fine to move all those instances to class level?
replies.author: lahirumaramba

timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I agree! This is better. Update the code. Thanks!
replies.author: lahirumaramba

timeline.bodyText: It's ok to define some of these as class level constants. For example templateNine can be a class-level constant, and templateTen can be initialized in the corresponding test case as a local var. Same goes for others.
timeline.author: hiranya911

replies.bodyText: I see what you mean now! Moved to class level constants. Thanks!
replies.author: lahirumaramba
